workflow.name: Getting Started 1 - JSON Placeholder Web Service
workflow.title: Getting Started 1 - JSON Placeholder Web Service

properties.description:
This is the first workflow in the "Getting Started" Series. 

This workflow makes a request to the "jsonplaceholder" Web Service and shows how to process information returned.

In this workflow no error checking is provided. This will be shown in other Exchange Workflows.

The HTTP Target for this workflow is "jsonplaceholder.typicode.com" that will provide a response to Web Requests.

The Target is automatically created during import if it doesn't already exist. 

When run, the workflow will call the Web Service for a list of usernames which are then extracted from the results.
properties.display_name: Getting Started 1 - JSON Placeholder Web Service

properties.description:
This is an an example of using an Atomic "HTTP Request" from the "Web Service" Adapter located on the left side of the designer pallete. 

The Properties below require only 2 fields be filled in:
- Relative URL :  Based on HTTP Target
- Method: GET Request

This is the Atomic "JSONPath Query" available in the "Core" Adapter allowing our workflow to derive data returned from our Web Service call to the JSON Placeholder Target.

Source JSON to Query: This points at the output of the "Web Service" call above.

JSONPath Query: This syntax describes the data to extract. In this case That will be all the "name" fields. 

Property Name: The data found is stored in this variable that could be used later in a workflow.
